Cool Jill I will check it out when I get time to listen. Its fine its in mp=
3 format. When group gets too full of the mp3 formats then I will let peopl=
e know if they have too much up. I usually suggest if someone wants to uplo=
ad many files they use esnips.com. Or if they want to upload wav files sinc=
e its not allowed here they can use their free esnips account to do whateve=
r format they wish and host multiple files. Glad ya figured out how to tran=
sfer them. I didnt know you didnt know how. Let us know if you have any pro=
blems!
=C2=A0
Misty

=C2=A0 



Just realized that I think my file is probably too large =
and is taking up all the group's space. If this is true, please let me know=
 immediately and I'll delete the file (since I have no idea how to make it =
smaller).

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Jill" <jjkamp@...> wrote:
>
> =
So I finally got some motivation and figured out how to get a file from my =
cassette tape to the computer. It's in the "Files" area here (hopefully I d=
id everything correctly and according to protocol):
> 
> http://tech. group=
s.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ Jill%27s% 20Ghost%20Box% 20Files/
> 
> I=
 cleaned it up somewhat in Audacity, taking out all the extra radio snippet=
s, so what's left is me asking for someone to say my niece's name, and then=
 the four "Katies" that came after that. There's even, I think, a fifth Kat=
ie tucked in there while I'm asking, as well as the obligatory "I love you"=
 first thing after I've finished asking. 
> 
> Some background: Got my niec=
e and cousin to do a session with me today. Cousin has been dragging her fe=
et, is skeptical, and the niece just arrived from out of town, is more open=
minded. I'm pleased we got someone to say her name four times in a row, and=
 I'm uploading it here so she can hear it back home. So this isn't the best=
 file I have. Maybe now that I know how to upload (if it worked), I can upl=
oad some of my better session happenings!
>
